Stack sizes are P0 (me): 970 chips, P1 (BB): 1000 chips. The pot is 30 and it currently costs 20 to call. K7-suited is generally a fold from out of position against a single opponent unless we plan to make a move, and shorthanded movement can be profitable.

Since we’re only 6 hands into a 10-hand match and my image so far has been tight-folding often, a small 3-bet bluff could buy the pot outright or set up future aggression. I’ll raise to 60 (three big blinds). If P1 wakes up with a hand, I can comfortably fold; if not, the stack pressure builds.
